subject: Re: [junit] how to test private method with Junit?
msgSnippet: Use reflection.  The example below uses the java reflection api to invoke a private method in the TestMe class. More information can be found at:
messageBody:
Use reflection. The example below uses the java reflection api to
invoke a private method in the TestMe class.

More information can be found at:
http://www.onjava.com/pub/a/onjava/2003/11/12/reflection.html

File: TestMe.java
-------------------------
public class TestMe {
private int add(int a, int b){
return a+b;
}
}

File: UnitTest_TestMe.java
---------------------------------------
import junit.framework.TestCase;
import java.lang.reflect.*;

public class UnitTest_TestMe extends TestCase {
public void test_add(){
try {
TestMe classUnderTest = new TestMe();
Class cls = Class.forName("TestMe");
Class paramTypes[] = new Class[2];
paramTypes[0] = Integer.TYPE;
paramTypes[1] = Integer.TYPE;
Method[] methods = cls.getDeclaredMethods();

for(int i=0; i<methods.length; i++){
if(methods[i].getName().equals("add")){
methods[i].setAccessible(true);
Object arglist[] = new Object[2];
arglist[0] = new Integer(37);
arglist[1] = new Integer(47);
Object retobj = methods[i].invoke(classUnderTest, arglist);
Integer retval = (Integer)retobj;
assertEquals(retval.intValue(), 37+47);
}
}
}
catch (Throwable e) {
System.err.println(e);
fail();
}
}
}
